column4: I‚Äôm so proud to have a casework team dedicated to serving #MN02 constituents. Since coming to Congress, we‚Äôve resolved more than 1,000 cases and returned more than $675,000 owed to folks in our community by the federal government. https://t.co/em7uquvj70 https://t.co/Ovqe5B7nCi

Yesterday, @IGHpdMN kicked off their partnership with @thevitalsapp to help our police officers and folks with mental health concerns communicate more effectively. I‚Äôm glad my staffer Morris was able to attend! https://t.co/LqajPFWX69

From health care and agriculture to infrastructure and education, I‚Äôve worked hard to find bipartisan approaches to the most pressing issues facing our community. I‚Äôm proud that since coming to Congress, 80% of my 31 bills introduced and 533 bills cosponsored are bipartisan. https://t.co/wO5U9Nnvfw

I want to recognize the great folks at the @DakotaCFC who have been providing free COVID-19 testing. I‚Äôm so glad that funds I voted for in the CARES Act have supported their work serving as a lifeline to folks in our community. https://t.co/ol0rhoDJ9n

Kim‚Äôs story is precisely why I‚Äôve focused on reducing the cost of health care and prescription drugs, and supported bold funding for cancer research and treatment development during my first term in Congress.
Without the protections provided by the Affordable Care Act, folks like Kim have to worry about lifetime limits on health coverage or even being denied coverage due to a preexisting condition.

Here in the land of 10,000 lakes, we know how vital clean water is to the health and beauty of our state. I‚Äôm proud to recognize the anniversary of the Clean Water Act and the benefits it has had on our communities since 1972. https://t.co/UBCApG49Tw

As our states, counties, cities and towns continue to face the unexpected costs brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic, we‚Äôve got to provide federal support. I‚Äôm pushing for direct flexible aid to support our teachers and first responders. #FundtheFrontLines https://t.co/7CV6S1kPLK

Rice County has announced the availability of grants for small businesses facing serious financial loss due to the COVID-19 pandemic. I‚Äôm glad that funds I voted for in the CARES Act are helping our community. Learn more here: https://t.co/GTZHPU7Qn0.

We‚Äôve got to hammer out a bipartisan solution as quickly as possible. Our schools need additional federal support as they face the unexpected costs brought on by this pandemic.
https://t.co/yDqDl68PU3

.@SCDCAP delivers 10,000 meals per month to seniors in our community. Thank you to all of their volunteers who help make this possible! Learn more about the Scott Carver Dakota Community Action Partnership at https://t.co/X1snt0W7pU.

I'm disappointed in the President's decision to end relief talks until after the election. This isn't about politics, it's about helping small businesses, aiding localities & funding testing, tracing and treatment efforts. Tonight, we passed critical legislation to protect lives and livelihoods as we continue to face the health and economic challenges of COVID-19. https://t.co/RzckNfeSJV

Earlier this year, I requested a report from @USCBO comparing multiple policy approaches to achieving universal health coverage. Today, this report was released and I‚Äôm hopeful that it will help us work on a bipartisan basis toward the goal of health care for every American.

I‚Äôve joined @StaceyPlaskett on bipartisan legislation to support our aviation workers by extending the Payroll Support Program through March of 2021.
